intro: Ruellia undulata, commonly known as the wavy ruellia, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its attractive, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from blue to purple. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub or subshrub, reaching heights of up to 1.5 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a wavy margin, contributing to its common name. Ruellia undulata is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in a variety of soil conditions.
